info.author: Kartik Talwar
info.description:
# topsis_kartiktalwar_102003475 ## What is TOPSIS Technique for Order Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution (TOPSIS) originated in the 1980s as a multi-criteria decision making method. ## Installation ```pip install kartik-talwar-102003475==1.2.1``` ## Input csv format Input file contain atleast three columns
First column is the object/variable name
Other columns contain numeric values only ## How to use it Command Prompt
``` topsis ```
Example:
``` topsis topsis.py inputfile.csv “1,1,1,1,2” “+,+,+,+,-” result.csv ```

Note: The weights and impacts should be ',' seperated, input file should be in pwd. ## Functions, Parameters and Return Values ``` function = topsis() parameters = No input parameters return values = Creates a csv file with the topsis rank and performance score ``` ## Sample input data | Model | P1 | P2 | P3 | P4 | P5 | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|-----:|-----:|-----:| | M1 | 0.62 | 0.38 | 3.8 | 33.8 | 9.65 | | M2 | 0.75 | 0.56 | 5.7 | 50.3 | 14.33 | | M3 | 0.95 | 0.90 | 6.5 | 65.6 | 18.49 | | M4 | 0.61 | 0.37 | 6.2 | 43.6 | 12.70 | | M5 | 0.60 | 0.36 | 6.4 | 61.2 | 17.14 | | M6 | 0.76 | 0.58 | 5.3 | 68.0 | 18.66 | | M7 | 0.66 | 0.44 | 6.2 | 47.2 | 13.63 | | M8 | 0.80 | 0.64 | 5.7 | 37.1 | 11.06 | ## Sample output data | Model | P1 | P2 | P3 | P4 | P5 | Performance Score | Topsis Rank | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|-----:|-----:|-----:| ---: | ---: | | M1 | 0.62 | 0.38 | 3.8 | 33.8 | 9.65 | 0.317272185 | 8 | | M2 | 0.75 | 0.56 | 5.7 | 50.3 | 14.33 | 0.452068871 | 4 | | M3 | 0.95 | 0.90 | 6.5 | 65.6 | 18.49 | 0.689037307 | 1 | | M4 | 0.61 | 0.37 | 6.2 | 43.6 | 12.70 | 0.340383903 | 7 | | M5 | 0.60 | 0.36 | 6.4 | 61.2 | 17.14 | 0.367206376 | 6 | | M6 | 0.76 | 0.58 | 5.3 | 68.0 | 18.66 | 0.481350901 | 3 | | M7 | 0.66 | 0.44 | 6.2 | 47.2 | 13.63 | 0.372999972 | 5 | | M8 | 0.80 | 0.64 | 5.7 | 37.1 | 11.06 | 0.51226635 | 2 |
